title: Kara Tointon looks chic as she steps out with fiancé Marius Jensen and their baby son Frey a
text:
She welcomed her first child in November last year.

And Kara Tointon looked every inch the yummy mummy as she stepped out with her fiancé Marius Jensen and their baby son Frey in London on Sunday.

The former EastEnders actress, 36, looked effortlessly chic in a black leather jacket as she left The London ITV Studios in White City, London after filming Sunday Brunch.

So chic: Kara Tointon looked every inch the yummy mummy as she stepped out with her fiancé Marius Jensen and their baby son Frey in London on Sunday

The mum-of-one looked relaxed and content following her stint on the cooking show as she joined her family for an Autumnal walk.

Kara, who played Dawn Swan in the BBC soap, layered her biker jacket over a navy hoodie and a plain black T-shirt.

She added a pair of blue jeans and black lace-up boots, carrying her essentials in a black rucksack and handbag.

The TV star left her brunette tresses to hang loosely in a wavy style, while she shielded her eyes from the sun in a pair of dark sunglasses.

Family time: The former EastEnders actress, 36, looked effortlessly chic in a black leather jacket as she left The London ITV Studios in White City, London after filming Sunday Brunch

She appeared in a chipper mood as she walked alongside her Norwegian beau, who was pushing along their 11-month-old boy.

Kara and Marius welcomed son Frey together in November last year, after first being spotted together a year earlier.

The couple spoke about the birth of their son in an interview with Hello! as they described the dramatic moment Kara was rushed into theatre for an emergency Caesarean section after their baby's heartbeat dropped.

She explained: 'Like everything in life, what you expect to happen, more often than not, doesn't. It did become quite dramatic and a bit frightening. I was in an episode of ER at that point. It all happened incredibly quickly.

Lovely: The mum-of-one looked relaxed and content following her stint on the cooking show as she joined her family for an Autumnal walk

Flawless: Kara, who played Dawn Swan in the BBC soap, layered her biker jacket over a navy hoodie and a plain black T-shirt

Chilled: She appeared in a chipper mood as she walked alongside her Norwegian beau, who was pushing along their 11-month-old boy

'There is a nine-month build and then you meet your baby and instantly they are engraved in your mind. Suddenly you know them deeper than anyone while having only just met.'

Kara announced she was expecting her first child in an interview with Hello! and described finding out she was pregnant as a 'life-changing' moment.

'It is the biggest life-changing moment when you have this little human being coming into your life that you are yet to meet,' she said.

'For me it was always about meeting the person that you know is the one you want to share this experience with.

'Marius and I said: ‘If it happens, we are ready, but we won’t plan. And then it happened quite quickly.'

Proud family: Kara gave birth to son Frey in November last year, after undergoing an emergency Caesarean section (the tot pictured above with Marius in August)
description: The former EastEnders actress, 36, looked effortlessly chic in a black leather jacket as she left The London ITV Studios in White City with her fiancé Marius Jensen and their baby son Frey on Sunday.
